text: Psalm 60
A Lament After a Defeat and a Prayer for Restoration
For the \add music\add* director, according to Shushan Eduth.\f + \fr Ps 60 \ft Perhaps “The Lily of Testimony” \f*
A miktam of David. To teach.

When he fought Mesopotamia and Aram Zobah, and Joab returned and struck Edom in the Valley of Salt, twelve thousand \add persons\add*.\f + \fr Ps 60 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first two verses of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by two \f*
O God, you have rejected us. You have broken us.
You have been angry. Restore us!
You have made \add the\add* land quake. You have split it open.
Heal its fissures, because it totters.
You have shown your people hard \add things\add*;
You have given us wine that staggers.
You have rallied those who fear you round a banner
⸤out of bowshot⸥,\f + \fr 60:4 \ft Literally “from \fq the \ft presence of \fq the \ft bow” \f* \qs Selah\qs*
so that your beloved ones may be rescued.
Save by your right hand and answer us.
God has spoken in his holiness,
“I will rejoice;
I will divide up Shechem,
and portion out the valley of Succoth.
Gilead \add is\add* mine, and Manasseh \add is\add* mine,
and Ephraim \add is\add* the ⸤helmet for⸥\f + \fr 60:7 \ft Literally “protection of” \f* my head;
Judah \add is\add* my scepter.\f + \fr 60:7 \ft Or “commander’s rod” \f*
Moab \add is\add* my washing pot;
over Edom, I will cast my sandal.
On account of me, O Philistia, raise a shout.”
Who will bring me to \add the\add* fortified city?
Who will lead me to Edom?
Have not you yourself rejected us, O God,
and not gone out with our armies, O God?
Give us help against \add the\add* adversary,
for the help of humankind \add is\add* futile.
Through God we will do ⸤valiantly⸥,\f + \fr 60:12 \ft Literally “might” \f*
and \add it is\add* he \add who\add* will tread down our enemies.
